definition: fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
our luck is in, everything is going smoothly (idiom)

sentences.english: And he defines it almost in terms of laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 而他解釋時運用的大多是物理的法則。

sentences.english: Triumphing over Death, and Chance, and thee, O Time.
sentences.chinese: 最終戰勝了死亡，時運，還有你，時間。

sentences.english: We haudio-videoe an auxiliary generator in case of power cuts.
sentences.chinese: 我們有一臺萬一斷電時運用的備用發電機。

sentences.english: Dingos have better luck hunting in packs when they're after large kangaroos .
sentences.chinese: 野狗在成羣追逐大袋鼠時運氣更好。

sentences.english: Enable to run a customized executable at shut-down.
sentences.chinese: 啓用關閉時運行定製的可執行文件。

sentences.english: Dingos have better luck hunting in packs when they're after large kangaroos.
sentences.chinese: 野狗在成羣追逐大袋鼠時運氣更好。

sentences.english: None of the great composers had a more unfortunate talent-to-luck ratio than Franz Schubert.
sentences.chinese: 從沒有一個偉大的作曲家像舒伯特那樣的時運不濟。

sentences.english: This drill Starts With swimmers in a prone position, With the hands extended in front, right hand over left.
sentences.chinese: 練習開始時運動員俯臥，雙臂前伸，右手在左手背上。

sentences.english: The moles and birthmarks in these areas can indicate good fortune, or a lack of it.
sentences.chinese: 痣或胎記落到這些區域有可能象徵好運或時運不濟。

sentences.english: As has been pointed out in Chapter 5 , the molecules move faster when they are heated .
sentences.chinese: 正如在第五章所指出的那樣，分子受熱時運動加快。

sentences.english: It's said that Yang's royal family would have it's time by then.
sentences.chinese: 據說當時時運將至，新昌皇族即將有出頭之日。

sentences.english: The psychology control force of the athletes will determine whether they can win or lose during the competition of the artistic gymnastics.
sentences.chinese: 藝術體操比賽時運動員的心理控制力決定比賽的成敗。

sentences.english: The U. S. military stcrafted Desert Shield with very poor maps of the region.
sentences.chinese: 美軍起首沙漠盾牌行動時運用確本地輿圖很差。

sentences.english: All the damage seems to have happened during transit.
sentences.chinese: 所有損壞看來都時運輸過程中造成。

sentences.english: That reduces the need to run the chillers during the day, when rates are higher.
sentences.chinese: 這減少了白天電費較高時運行製冷器的需求。

sentences.english: SLIDE may run slow in Landscape mode or even the screen turns blank.
sentences.chinese: 程序在橫屏時運行緩慢甚至變爲空白。

definition: when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
to put on weight/to get fat (a sign of prosperity, so a compliment)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
to plan matters/to look for a job
to have achieved nothing/to be a total failure/to get nowhere
